shortlist.name: Ammes (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win, indicating peak form. Sean Bowen is a reliable jockey and James Owen is in good recent form. The odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to maintain its winning run. No signs of needing major improvement and connections are solid.

shortlist.name: Treasure Planet (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unexposed but represents top connections—Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden—who excel with debutants at this venue. Market support is notable, and the lack of form is offset by stable reputation and jockey booking. Not a longshot and likely to be ready first time out.

shortlist.name: Ben Solo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with consistent recent placings (2-2-8 last three). Rebecca Curtis stable in form. Strong course/distance angle with proven ability at this level. Current form cycle suggests ready to peak.

shortlist.name: Tintintin (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Last-time-out winner returning to winning form after mid-season blip. Fergal O'Brien yard hitting winners. Proven at this grade with winning form in the book. Burke/O'Brien combination reliable.

shortlist.name: In The Air (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong progressive profile with three consecutive placed efforts (1-2-1-2). Upward form curve indicates horse peaking now. French-bred typically suits testing ground at Chepstow. Represents each-way value.

shortlist.name: Destroytheevidence
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 5.7 exchange (current favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a string of runner-up finishes last season, suggesting reliability and competitiveness. Connections are respected, and the market positions him as the one to beat. No major negatives in recent form, and the price is fair for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Ask Brewster (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ended last season with back-to-back wins, indicating progressive form and ability to handle competitive fields. Trainer and jockey are both capable at this venue. Odds reflect genuine market respect, and the profile suggests further improvement is possible.

shortlist.name: Ile De Jersey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Comes from a top yard and has won three of last four starts, showing both class and consistency. Recent form is strong, and the booking of Nico de Boinville is a positive. Market position is justified given connections and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: French Ship
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form last season, strong connections, and current odds indicate market confidence. Recent form figures show consistency and ability to win off a break, suggesting readiness and class for this level.

shortlist.name: Royal Infantry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this class, with multiple wins and placed efforts last season. Top trainer/jockey combination adds further confidence. Recent form is solid and suggests reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Gibbs Island
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.6 exchange (current favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last four starts, lightly raced and open to further improvement. Trainer Tom Lacey is adept with similar types and the market support is notable. The recent 'P' and '8' can be forgiven given the overall upward trajectory and possible excuses (e.g., unsuitable conditions or needed the run after a break).

shortlist.name: Hope Rising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent with a string of wins and seconds, indicating reliability and peak form. Jamie Snowden's yard is in good order and Gavin Sheehan is a positive booking. The horse's ability to hold form over several runs is a major asset in this field.

shortlist.name: Gustapof (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 17/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (not an outsider, strong exchange support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid recent placings and a top jockey in Sean Bowen. The exchange price is notably shorter than fixed odds, suggesting smart money and value. Rebecca Curtis is a respected trainer at this venue.

shortlist.name: American Land (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.95 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with four wins from last five starts, including a perfect 2/2 this season. Proven fitness, top connections, and current form suggest he is peaking. Market confidence reinforces his status as the one to beat.

shortlist.name: No But I Will
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time out and placed efforts prior. Has shown steady improvement and is holding form well. Odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Lightning Flash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time after a string of competitive efforts. Top jockey booking and respected yard. If building on latest success, profiles as a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Theatre Of Flight
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, winning last time out after a progressive profile. Connections are respected and the market strongly supports his chance. No signs of regression and holds the best recent form in the field.

shortlist.name: Paddy De Pole (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.9 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win, trained by Paul Nicholls who excels with this type. Form is reliable and the odds reflect strong support. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Platenium (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a last-time-out win, indicating peak form and progression. Connections are reliable at this level. The horse is well found in the market, suggesting strong confidence from both public and professionals. Recent form is superior to the field, and the odds reflect genuine winning chance rather than hype.

shortlist.name: O'faolains Glory (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a runner-up finish last time, suggests the horse is holding condition well and is competitive at this level. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability to place and potentially improve. Connections are capable and the profile fits a typical winner in this grade.

shortlist.name: Imperfectlyperfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place from three starts, representing top connections in Lucinda Russell & Michael Scudamore. The recent form is unexposed and suggests further improvement is likely. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Tamarind Bay (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer at this level with several recent third-place finishes, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are capable and the odds are fair for an each-way or win contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Pismo Beach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in recent runs, regularly finishing in the places. Connections are reliable and the horse is well supported in the market, indicating stable confidence. No signs of decline and should be fit after a break. The odds reflect clear market support and form superiority.

shortlist.name: Highbury Hill
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is competitive, with several placed efforts and no major negatives. Trainer and jockey have solid records at this level. The odds offer value for a runner with proven ability to hit the frame, and the horse does not require significant improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: King Roly
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three wins from last five starts and no major layoff. Consistent, progressive profile and holds the best recent figures in the field. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No need for improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Florida Dreams (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple placings and a top jockey booked. Recent form figures show reliability and ability to compete in similar company. Represents a stable in good form and is well found in the market.

shortlist.name: Roger Pol (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive form with three wins and two places from last six starts. Jamie Snowden yard in good order, and jockey Isabelle Ryder is a positive booking. The horse is clearly in peak form and does not need to improve to win this.

shortlist.name: Idem (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and has shown ability in better company. Trainer/jockey combination is strong, and the horse is race-fit. The form is a little patchy, but the last run suggests he is back to his best and is a major player.

shortlist.name: Pinot Rouge (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and has shown improved form recently. The yard is in form, and the horse is clearly on the up. However, the overall profile is less consistent than the top two, and he may need to confirm the improvement.

shortlist.name: Ballydangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 5.0 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, having won two of last three starts and placed in the other. Consistent, progressive profile and proven ability to win in similar company. Market support is strong, indicating confidence. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Ribeye
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid recent form figures, including a win and two placings from last four starts. Exchange price suggests strong support. Reliable connections and no major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Fox's Fancy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, progressive profile with multiple placings and a win in last five starts. Returns from a break but yard is adept at readying horses fresh. Market position suggests expectation of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Freddie Steady Go
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and placed on reappearance, showing proven ability and consistency. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and he sets the standard on form among this field.

shortlist.name: Tony Joe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid third on debut, representing a top trainer in this sphere. Market support is notable and he looks open to improvement with experience.

shortlist.name: March On Oxo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from a powerful dual trainer partnership, respected on connections and market position. Lack of form is a question but not discounted given stable record with newcomers.

shortlist.name: Damysus
shortlist.rationale: Comes from a top yard, has strong recent form including a win last time out, and is the clear market leader. The combination of a proven jockey, trainer, and current form makes Damysus the most solid contender.

shortlist.name: Gladius (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins this season and a top jockey booked. Recent form is solid and odds are competitive for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: First Conquest
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading stable and has been running consistently well in competitive company. Multiple wins this campaign and a top jockey add to his appeal.

shortlist.name: Endorsement (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.55 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and top connections. O'Brien targets this meeting and Lordan is a reliable big-race jockey. Form cycle suggests further improvement likely and market confidence is notable.

shortlist.name: Look To The Stars (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.3 exchange (solid second choice, holding firm in market)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives on a hat-trick, showing consistent improvement and winning form. Appleby and Buick are a top Newmarket combination. Recent wins indicate peaking form and no sign of regression.

shortlist.name: Spyce
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.4 exchange (third in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win last time, suggesting upside. Trainer/jockey combo is reliable and form cycle analysis points to further progress rather than regression.

shortlist.name: Al Zanati
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten with single winning start suggests unexposed potential. Elite Appleby/Buick combination excels with progressive types at Newmarket headquarters. Form figure of '1' indicates ready-made improvement unlikely needed. Competitive odds reflect genuine class.

shortlist.name: Hankelow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form showing upward trajectory (2nd then 1st). Karl Burke stable in excellent form. Proven winning ability demonstrated last time out. Shares joint-favouritism reflecting market confidence in current condition.

shortlist.name: Straight Up (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner from Ballydoyle representing champion trainer O'Brien. Experienced international jockey Soumillon booked suggests stable confidence. Single winning run indicates scope without requiring dramatic improvement. Ballydoyle raiders typically well-prepared for Newmarket assignments.

shortlist.name: Distant Storm
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, trained by a top yard in excellent form, and partnered by a leading jockey. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and align with recent form at this level.

shortlist.name: Zavateri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in four starts, demonstrating consistency and clear upward trajectory. While stepping up in class, the winning streak and competitive odds indicate genuine contender status.

shortlist.name: Gstaad
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at a high level, trained by a world-class operation. Recent placings suggest reliability and ability to compete with the best in this field. Odds offer fair value for proven Group-level form.

shortlist.name: Reverend Hubert (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.8 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, indicating peak fitness. Proven stamina and strong connections with a top Irish trainer and a reliable jockey. Odds reflect genuine market respect and suggest he is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Dawn Rising (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 8.4 exchange (well found in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently campaigned at a high level; recent efforts suggest a return to form is possible. Top-class connections with a leading jockey and trainer. Odds indicate strong market confidence and he does not require major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: Beylerbeyi
shortlist.odds_note: 8/1 SBK, 10 exchange (respected in betting, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple wins and placings in recent starts. Proven ability to handle competitive handicaps and remains in good form. Odds are fair for a horse with this level of consistency.

shortlist.name: Wedonttelllies (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and a solid placed effort prior. Market leader with strong, consistent form and no signs of regression. Trainer and jockey both in good recent form. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Blue To Blue (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent, winning two of last three and never out of the frame in recent starts. Reliable profile, proven at this level, and connections are in form. Odds reflect strong chance and no major improvement required.

shortlist.name: Pacifica Pier (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.2 exchange (solid third choice, respected yard)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for improvement, placed on debut and won second start. Last run was below best but retains potential for top connections. Odds indicate market respect and not an outsider.

shortlist.name: Celandine
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with strong recent form figures, including multiple placings and a win last season. Remains competitively priced at the head of the market, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No sign of regression in recent runs, and the Shoemark/Walker combination is reliable.

shortlist.name: Dubai Treasure (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced this season with two wins from last four starts, including a recent victory at a similar level. Top connections (Murphy/bin Suroor) add further appeal. Recent eighth can be forgiven given prior consistency and upside potential.

shortlist.name: Alfa Kellenic
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 (SBK), 7.4 (Exchange) – third in market, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Rattled off a sequence of wins last season, showing clear ability at this grade. Only run this year was a disappointing reappearance, but entitled to come on for that effort. Retains De Sousa and market support is notable for a return to form.

shortlist.name: Typeface
shortlist.rationale: Typeface arrives in peak form with two recent wins and a close second last time, indicating consistency and improvement. The odds reflect strong market support, and Ian Williams is a respected trainer with a good record at Wolverhampton. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: No Claims Bonus
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows clear improvement (0-7-5-3), suggesting the horse is coming to hand. Luke Morris is a top jockey, and Harry Eustace is a respected trainer. The odds are fair for a horse on an upward curve, and this runner does not need major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Shetakesthegold
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts (1-3-4-2) in recent starts. Richard Hannon is a leading trainer, and the horse is proven at this level. The odds represent solid value for a horse that is regularly competitive and does not need to find significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Oh So Perfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for progression. Trainer Charlie Fellowes is shrewd with this type, and the horse is not exposed. The odds are slightly cramped, but the potential for natural improvement makes this a credible contender in a modest race.

shortlist.name: Woody Y Fernandez
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive places, indicating reliability and readiness. Connections are experienced, and current odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Miss Ayala (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Latest win signals peak form and improvement. Trainer has a good record with similar types, and odds are competitive. Recent form suggests the horse is on an upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Thanh Nam
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth-place finish shows competitiveness at this level. Odds indicate market respect, and connections are capable. Form is steady, with potential to improve further.

shortlist.name: Nala's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two consecutive third-place finishes, indicating reliability and readiness. Trained by Richard Fahey, a respected trainer, and holds clear market support as favourite. No signs of regression and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Hvar
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 11/4 SBK, 3.1 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile for a top yard (Ralph Beckett). Fifth and fourth in last two starts suggest improvement and potential to step forward again. Market support is solid and connections are strong.

shortlist.name: Good Earth (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three top-six finishes in last four starts, including a close second. Trainer and jockey are in solid form. Odds represent fair value for a horse with proven competitiveness at this level.

shortlist.name: Fletchers Dream
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out, indicating current peak form. Trainer and jockey have a good strike rate together. Slightly shorter odds than Good Earth, but recent win justifies favoritism.

shortlist.name: Hasiyna (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in recent starts, with three top-five finishes in last four runs. Luke Morris is a top jockey and the Irish trainer brings strong form. Odds offer value for a horse with solid each-way claims.

shortlist.name: Francisco
shortlist.rationale: Has been competitive in similar company, with three top-three finishes in last six starts. Trainer is capable with this type. Odds are fair for a horse that could hit the frame.

shortlist.name: Ever Driven (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.4 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, suggesting peak fitness and improvement. Top connections for this level, and the market strongly supports chances. No need for major improvement based on latest effort and profile.

shortlist.name: Imola (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, running respectably in similar company. Exchange market suggests stronger chance than fixed-odds, indicating value. No major negatives in profile; should be competitive if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Rockstar Icon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.7 exchange (well found in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, regularly finishing in midfield or better. Market respect and solid connections. Profile suggests capable of winning without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Schemaya (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strongly supported on exchange (2.8), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive company, holding form well without major regression. Connections are respected at this level. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade.

shortlist.name: Curran (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (4.1 exchange), solid support.
shortlist.rationale: Regularly hitting the frame and running to a reliable level. Trainer excels with similar types at Wolverhampton. Recent form is competitive and odds offer fair value for a consistent performer.

shortlist.name: Basholo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows some consistency with a couple of near misses, and the odds offer reasonable value for a competitive run.

shortlist.name: Henery Hawk
shortlist.rationale: Form indicates a mix of strong and weaker performances, but the odds suggest potential for a good run.

shortlist.name: Street Life
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes some strong finishes, and the odds are competitive for a potential win.

shortlist.name: Rumba Bay
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with several strong finishes, making it a contender at these odds.

shortlist.name: River Wharfe
shortlist.rationale: Recent winning form and consistent finishes indicate peak condition. Trainer Tony Carroll is reliable at Wolverhampton, and the odds suggest market confidence. The horse has shown ability to win and place repeatedly, with no major drop-off in form.

shortlist.name: Wyvern
shortlist.odds_note: Solid value: 9/2 SBK, 2.4 exchange (shortest on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Wyvern is the current exchange favourite, indicating strong market support. Recent form includes several placed efforts, suggesting reliability at this level. Connections are capable, and the horse does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Claxton Bay
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed form earlier in the sequence, with a trainer who often targets Wolverhampton. Recent zeros are a concern but not indicative of major decline given prior consistency. Odds offer value for a runner proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Division
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.3 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from last three starts, representing a top yard in excellent form. Reliable jockey booking and strong, consistent recent form make this runner the most likely winner. Odds reflect strong market confidence and form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Flying Comet
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.4 exchange (second choice in market, well respected)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a win in recent starts. Connections are in good form and the horse has shown versatility and reliability at this level. Odds are fair for a runner with proven ability to compete for the win.

shortlist.name: Erzindjan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with top jockey Marquand aboard. Recent form shows two solid placing efforts (4th, 7th, 4th) after lengthy absence period. Fitness should be optimal after three runs back. Strong connections with proven pilot.

shortlist.name: Insanity
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with 3rd and 2nd in last two starts showing clear upward trajectory. Well-handicapped by respected trainer Alan King. Form figures demonstrate horse is fit and competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Tony Montana
shortlist.rationale: Progressive form pattern with back-to-back wins earlier in campaign (2nd, 2nd positions). Quality pilot Egan takes the ride for established trainer Bell. Recent competitive efforts suggest ready to strike again.

shortlist.name: Per Contra (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Highly consistent form with recent win (1st) backed by string of placed efforts. Never finishes outside top seven in current campaign. Easterby yard in good form, represents solid each-way value.

shortlist.name: Northern Ticker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins and a third from last six starts, including a recent win this season. Trainer and jockey are reliable at this level. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Hammer The Hammer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with three wins and two seconds in last six runs, showing consistency and ability at this class. Trainer is in good form. Odds are fair for a horse with proven winning profile.

shortlist.name: Binhareer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and two placings from last five starts. Top connections (Haggas/Marquand) add confidence. Recent form is solid and odds offer some value.

shortlist.name: Joulany (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/6 (exchange 2.12), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, showing immediate ability and professionalism. Beckett is a top trainer for juveniles at York, and the market support is significant. With a proven jockey and no need for major improvement, this colt sets the standard on form and connections.

shortlist.name: Morshdi
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 11/4 (exchange 4.1), respected.
shortlist.rationale: Also finished second on debut, trained by Haggas who excels with 2yos at York. Marquand is a top jockey booking. The form is solid and the odds offer fair value for a likely improver from a powerful yard.

shortlist.name: Valenday
shortlist.odds_note: Third in betting at 4/1 (exchange 5.5), within range.
shortlist.rationale: Another debut runner-up, representing a yard with a good record at York. While not as strong on paper as the top two, the form is consistent and the odds are competitive for a place or upset if the principals underperform.

shortlist.name: Berkshire Sundance (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 7.4 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with two wins and a second before a break; returns for a top yard with strong jockey booking. Market support is notable and connections are reliable at York. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Ribble Vibe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in competitive handicaps, holding form well this season. Trainer excels at York and the exchange price suggests strong support. Has run well at this level and does not require significant improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Spioradalta
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in outstanding form with four consecutive wins, showing consistency and peak fitness. Connections are reliable, and current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven winning ability at this level.

shortlist.name: I Still Have Faith
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings indicate strong current form and readiness to win. Odds are competitive, and the horse has shown ability to handle similar company, making it a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Rajapour (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is respectable with two solid efforts earlier in the campaign. Trainer and jockey are both capable at York, and odds are reasonable for a horse with proven class at this level.

shortlist.name: Relieved Of Duties (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple recent placings and wins, trained by Gordon Elliott who excels at Fairyhouse, and partnered by top jockey J. W. Kennedy. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest peak fitness. No major negatives in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Full Of Life (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and a respectable fourth last time out. Trained by Henry de Bromhead, a proven operator at this level. Odds indicate genuine market respect and the horse is in reliable form without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Koori Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings, including a runner-up finish two starts ago. Trainer Peter Fahey is adept with this type, and the odds suggest the horse is expected to be competitive. No signs of decline in form.

shortlist.name: Come On The Lads (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been consistently in the mix with several placings and a win in recent starts. Trainer Gavin Cromwell is reliable, and jockey Keith Donoghue is experienced. Odds indicate the horse is not an outsider and recent form is competitive.

shortlist.name: Kamikaz Du Plessis (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and three placings from last five starts, indicating reliability and peak condition. Trained by Gordon Elliott and ridden by top jockey J. W. Kennedy, both highly respected at this venue. Odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Barry Lyndon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and solid placed efforts prior, showing ability to compete at this level. Market support is strong, and connections are capable. Form suggests the horse is holding condition and does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Must Meet Cecil (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, holding form well and regularly in the mix. Odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections have been competitive at this level. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Malbay Madness (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and unseated last time, so not exposed as out of form. Trainer is capable in these events. Odds suggest market respect. Has shown ability to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Desert Haven
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 3.4 exchange (market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in two of last four starts, showing competitive ability in similar company. Trainer is respected. Odds reflect realistic winning chance. Recent form is reliable and consistent.

shortlist.name: Midnight Moonshine (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.3 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last four starts, indicating reliability and current fitness. Odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are in good order and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Another Choice (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time out, suggesting improvement and readiness. Odds are competitive and indicate market respect. Trainer has a good record with similar types and the horse is holding form at the right time.

shortlist.name: Western Model (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 4.9 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in two of last three starts, showing consistency at this grade. Trainer and jockey are reliable at this venue. Odds suggest the horse is expected to be competitive and does not require major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: High Notions (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as favourite, solid recent third on debut indicating ability, and open to significant improvement with experience. Connections are capable and the horse is fit and progressive.

shortlist.name: Apples Jane (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in bumpers and hurdles, proven ability to place at this level, and trained by a top yard. Recent second shows current fitness and reliability.

shortlist.name: Noble Name (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form figures suggest reliability and competitiveness. Not far behind the principals on ability and has shown versatility.

shortlist.name: Cowper Hall (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows marked improvement with two solid placed efforts before a break, indicating an upward form cycle. Trained by Cromwell, a proven operator at this level, and current odds reflect strong market support. Connections and trajectory suggest readiness to peak.

shortlist.name: Farrokh (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a close second last time. No major dips in performance, suggesting reliability and fitness. Sean Flanagan is a capable jockey, and Connell’s runners often hold their form well. Odds offer fair value for a horse with proven consistency.

shortlist.name: Minella Jury (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/6 (1.8 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Comes from a respected yard with a top amateur jockey. Recent third on debut suggests improvement likely, and the market is heavily in support. No signs of needing major improvement and should be peaking second time out.

shortlist.name: Ballymoreen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 10/3 (3.65 exchange).
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a promising fourth on debut, open to progress. Market support is solid and profile fits for a typical bumper winner at this level. No evidence of regression or need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Cape Cod (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 3rd and 2nd in last two starts, indicating progression and reliability. Trained by Aidan O'Brien, a top-class trainer, and holds clear market support as favourite. No signs of needing major improvement and should be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Enceladus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debuted with a promising 3rd, suggesting ability and scope for improvement. Represents a leading stable with a strong record in similar races. Market position reflects respect and expectation of further progress.

shortlist.name: Choir Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: No form but significant market support for a debutant from the O'Brien yard, indicating strong stable confidence. Well-bred and likely to be ready first time out given connections.

shortlist.name: Diego El Queso (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Top jockey and trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Retrograde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading stable and top jockey. While only fifth on debut, improvement is likely on second start, and market support is notable. Connections and potential for progress make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Tokyo Treasure (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/2 (SBK), 3.65 (exchange) – supported in market, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Showed marked improvement from debut to latest start (8th to 3rd). Market support suggests further progress is expected. Recent form is competitive and runner is open to more improvement.

shortlist.name: Nakamura (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear progression and fitness. Trainer is in good recent form and the odds reflect strong market support. Reliable recent performances over similar conditions.

shortlist.name: Morehampton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a win and placed efforts in last four starts. Stable is in form and market support is solid. Recent runs suggest readiness and ability to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: First Approach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections and has competitive form in higher grade races. Odds indicate respect from the market. Has shown ability to place and win in similar company, and trainer excels with this profile.

shortlist.name: Amiata (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals improvement and readiness. Jockey/trainer combination is notable for success at this venue. Odds are competitive and form is trending upward.

shortlist.name: Thunderbear (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (sbk), 3.65 (exchange) - solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple recent placings and a fair seasonal profile. Odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are reliable and the horse has shown ability to handle similar company.

shortlist.name: Fandom
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a progressive profile last season and a promising return run. Top connections and scope for improvement. Odds reflect respect from the market and suggest readiness.

shortlist.name: Queen Of Mougins (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 (sbk), 4.1 (exchange) - prominent in betting, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with a recent win this season and solid placed form at this level. Reliable connections and market position suggest she is expected to run well again.

shortlist.name: Powerful Nation (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 (sbk), 3 (exchange) - strong exchange support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Early season form was strong, including a win and a second. Recent runs less inspiring but drop in class and strong market support suggest a return to form is possible.

shortlist.name: Nezeeh (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Nezeeh arrives in top form, winning 3 of last 5 starts and rarely running a poor race. The consistent profile, strong recent win, and competitive odds make this runner a standout. Trainer/jockey combo is proven and the horse is reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Escaping Thejungle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals a return to form after a win two starts back. Has shown ability to win at this level and is well-supported in the market. Connections are in good order and the horse is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Arklow Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and progressive, coming off a win last time out. The upward trajectory and strong connections suggest further improvement is likely. Market support is notable and the profile fits a typical winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Likedbymike (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second indicates a return to form. Has competitive back-class and is partnered by a top jockey. Consistent at this grade and offers value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Rowdy Yeats (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placings this season, indicating peak form. Top jockey booking and trainer in good form. Odds reflect strong market confidence and align with statistical likelihood of winner coming from top of the market.

shortlist.name: Bishopton (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.65 exchange (well-backed, near the top of the market)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives off back-to-back wins, suggesting clear improvement and ability to handle current conditions. Form is progressive and odds indicate strong market respect. Connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Tina's Indian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third signals return to form after a win earlier in the year. Consistent at this level and market support is notable. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable.

shortlist.name: Samangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early markets, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French stable with a leading jockey; connections are highly respected at Chantilly. Early market support suggests strong expectations. Barzalona and Graffard have an excellent record together, and the lack of form data is less concerning given the stable's ability to ready newcomers or lightly raced types for major targets.

shortlist.name: Street Show (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Guyon is a top jockey at Chantilly and the Brandt stable is in good form. Market position indicates respect, and local knowledge is a plus. Connections are known for placing horses well in these conditions.

shortlist.name: Nitoi (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Andre Fabre and Maxime Guyon, both highly successful at Chantilly. Typically, Fabre's runners are well-prepared and Guyon is a leading jockey, suggesting strong intent. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Midak (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in betting; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Graffard and Barzalona are a proven combination at this level. Barzalona is a top jockey in France, and Graffard's runners are consistently competitive at Chantilly. Market position indicates stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Amilcare (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Cristian Demuro is a leading rider and Baratti is an emerging trainer with a strong record in similar races. Early odds suggest the horse is expected to be competitive, and connections are respected.

shortlist.name: Kenzel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French yard with a leading jockey booking. Christophe Ferland is a proven trainer at this level, and Maxime Guyon is one of the most reliable jockeys in France. Market support suggests strong stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Ulymine (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: From a respected French stable with a capable jockey. The C. & Y. Lerner team is known for placing their horses well at Chantilly, and early odds indicate the horse is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Piana (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in betting; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Stephane Pasquier is a top jockey with a strong record at Chantilly. N. Caullery is a trainer who often targets these races successfully. Market position and connections make this runner a key contender.

shortlist.name: Opulent Restraint (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and fixed-odds markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Chad Brown, a leading turf trainer in the US, and ridden by Joel Rosario, both of whom have strong records at Keeneland. Market support is notable and connections are highly respected. No need for major improvement based on profile.

shortlist.name: Destino D'oro (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Brad Cox and Irad Ortiz Jr. are a top trainer-jockey combination with a high strike rate in graded and allowance company. Market position suggests strong expectations. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Will Then (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting; respected connections.
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is an elite international jockey and Jonathan Thomas is a capable trainer. The horse is well supported in the market, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No signs of being outclassed or needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Fionn (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Among market leaders; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Another Brad Cox runner, this time with Flavien Prat, a top jockey. The stable's strength and market position make this runner a logical inclusion. No major improvement required on known profile.

shortlist.name: Golden Canary (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a market leader in Woodbine juvenile fillies' stakes; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Mark Casse, a dominant Woodbine trainer with a strong record in 2yo races. Golden Canary has previously shown high-class form at this venue and typically attracts strong market support. Connections and prior performances suggest she is a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Biles (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be prominent in the market given connections and typical Carroll/Husbands support.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Josie Carroll stable, which excels with imported juveniles at Woodbine. Patrick Husbands is a top jockey at this track. The Carroll/Husbands combination is highly effective, and Biles is likely to be well-prepared and supported in the betting.

shortlist.name: A Little Frisky (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Stablemate to Biles, often well-fancied in similar company.
shortlist.rationale: Another Josie Carroll runner, suggesting stable confidence in this race. Carroll's fillies are regularly competitive at this level, and the lack of a named jockey at this stage is not a negative for a stable of this size. Market support is likely.

shortlist.name: Pop Idol (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top connections and typical market behavior for this profile.
shortlist.rationale: Pop Idol (Can) is partnered with Hall of Fame jockey John R. Velazquez and trained by George Weaver, a proven combination at Aqueduct. Even without published recent form, this pairing consistently attracts market support and delivers strong performances, especially in maiden or allowance company. The lack of form data is mitigated by the high quality of connections and likely market respect.

shortlist.name: Flat Out Time (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well found in the market due to Castellano/Weaver combination.
shortlist.rationale: Flat Out Time (Usa) is another George Weaver runner, this time with Javier Castellano, another elite jockey. This combination is regularly competitive at this level, and Weaver often runs live chances with multiple entries. Market support is expected, and the connections alone make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Abientot (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be prominent in the betting given Casse's reputation and Davis's local record.
shortlist.rationale: Abientot (Usa) is trained by Mark Casse, a top North American trainer, and ridden by Dylan Davis, who is well established at Aqueduct. Casse's runners are typically well prepared and attract market attention, especially with a competent local jockey. Even without visible form, the connections suggest readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Army Gal (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be single-figure odds based on Rice/Lezcano partnership.
shortlist.rationale: Army Gal (Usa) is trained by Linda Rice, a perennial leading trainer at Aqueduct, and ridden by Jose Lezcano, another top local jockey. This combination is frequently competitive in New York circuits, and Rice's runners are rarely overlooked in the market. The lack of form is less concerning given the strength of connections.

shortlist.name: Stone Of Scone (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with consistent recent form figures, including two placings and a close fourth. Connections are strong, and the horse is holding form well, suggesting readiness to win at this level. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Top Shelf Teddy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with clear improvement from debut to latest start (7th to 3rd). Top stable and jockey combination. The upward trajectory and strong market position make this runner a prime contender.

shortlist.name: Korcula (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Showed immediate improvement from debut to second start, finishing 3rd last time. Lightly raced and open to further progress. Connections are respected and the horse is likely to be peaking in fitness, making it a strong contender in a weak maiden field.

shortlist.name: Royale Jacket (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings at this level. Proven ability to handle the grade and trip. Reliable form profile and should be in the mix again, especially if others fail to improve.

shortlist.name: Green Machine (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Produced a promising debut with a third-place finish, suggesting natural improvement is likely. Trained by the de Kock team, who are highly respected and excel with young horses at this venue. Jockey booking is notable. Market support at 1.52 confirms strong expectations.

shortlist.name: Itsnowornever (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two seventh-place finishes followed by a runner-up effort, indicating progression. The latest second suggests readiness to win in this company. Odds reflect solid market confidence.

shortlist.name: Super Awesome (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint market leader at 1.52 exchange odds.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and runner-up finish indicate peak form and consistency. Trainer and jockey have strong local records. No signs of decline in recent runs, making this runner a standout on current form and connections[1][3][8].

shortlist.name: It's Personal (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint market leader at 1.52 exchange odds.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent top-three finishes, including a recent win and second, suggest reliable form. Connections are proven at this venue. No major improvement needed, and odds reflect strong market support[1][3][8].

shortlist.name: Hemisphere (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Joint market leader at 1.52 exchange odds.
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins and places in last five starts, showing sustained form at this level. Trainer and jockey are respected locally. Recent fourth not a negative given prior consistency[1][3][8].

shortlist.name: Matcha Mint (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win, indicating peak condition. Top local jockey and trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Chronicle King (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.22, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive form with two wins and two places in last five starts. Top jockey and trainer combination. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Copper Eagle (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, won debut and runner-up next time, suggesting scope for further improvement. Strong connections and positive market signals.

shortlist.name: Echo Check (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.22, among the market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, showing clear ability and potential. Trainer in form and market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Roaming Spirit (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a strong win and consistent performances, indicating good current form. The de Kock stable is renowned for producing winners.

shortlist.name: Pennsylvania (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a second place finish, suggesting a strong contender. Trainer A. P. Peter has a good reputation.

shortlist.name: Trip To States (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals peak form and readiness; consistent prior placings suggest reliability. Trainer Jonker is respected locally, and jockey Maujean is proven at Turffontein. No major improvement needed, and odds reflect market confidence.

shortlist.name: Phala Millions (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Form shows multiple recent placings and a win, indicating consistency and competitiveness at this level. Connections are solid, and the horse is holding form. Odds suggest market expects a strong run.

shortlist.name: Princess Lola (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive with several top-four finishes, and jockey Yeni is one of the most reliable in South Africa. Trainer Magner is capable at this venue. No signs of decline, and odds indicate strong support.
